intro: Taraxacum leucospermum, commonly known as the white-rayed dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and is characterized by its bright yellow flower head surrounded by white ray florets. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its life cycle includes a basal rosette of leaves and a single, stout stem that supports the flowering head. The species is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its unique floral appearance.
